Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that is healthy and growing when it has enough water.
The student can depict a plant that looks unhealthy or is not growing well when it does not get enough water.
The student can include details showing that plants need both water and light to live and grow.
The student can identify and illustrate patterns showing the differences between plants with enough water and those without.
